adjective.description: Not plumb: (literal) not vertical or straight; (figurative) not true or upstanding.

verb.description: To disconnect (a toilet, washing machine, etc.) from a water supply and drain.

origin: Early 19th century; earliest use found in Thomas Carlyle (1795–1881), author, biographer, and historian. From un- + plumb<br>late 18th century (in an earlier sense). From un- + plumb.
